data.description:
Try grocery shopping with your Pebble, it's perfect for keeping your hands free when you're shopping and speeds up the proces - and minimises the risk of dropping your phone! 

Grosh is the first commercial grocery app that adds Pebble support. Grosh is like no other grocery shopping app you have seen, it comes with intelligent suggestions and orders your list according the the store layout. 

How to get started:
1) Download the normal Grosh app on your phone (iOS, Android or web version) to get a FREE account that your watch app can connect to. Use the normal Grosh app to update and share your list before shopping.  
2) Download Grosh for Pebble 
3) Enter your Grosh account credentials by hitting the settings icon next to Grosh in your list of Pebble apps
4) Launch Grosh for Pebble. The list will be sorted, if your're in a store according to the layout. 
5) Click the select button to mark items as purchased.
6) Shake the watch to check for updates to list, eg if partner added something to the list after you left home.
7) Long press select button to change list or modify quantity (set to 0 to delete item)
8) Use ""+ Add item"" to dictate a new item (requires microphone), including quantity eg. 5 milk

Grosh supports stores in 31 countries and 18 languages.

Grosh is built by a small team dedicated to bring you the best shopping app ever. We publish frequent free updates and would love your feedback. Get in touch via our homepage groshapp.com, our Facebook and Google+ pages called Groshapp or tweet us @groshapp.

latest_release.release_notes: Added about screen in context menu for support cases

data.description:
Wondering when you will get to the station everything when you rush out your home? This is a tool for you. CanIMakeIt shows you the distance to your destination and base on your current to calculate when you will be there. But remember this use a very simple algorithm to calculate, don't relay on this, judge by yourself.

How to use:
You need to be the location you want to go to, for example, the train station you normally commute to. Mark your current position as you destination. At the moment, this is the only way to set your destination. Next time, when you want to travel to this station(destination), you can just select the location you that you mark in this watch app. What you will see is the distance to your destination, and the estimate arrival time base on your current speed. Note: the speed and estimate arrival time is calculated with a very simple algorithm. It's for your reference only. 

How this works (algorithm)
Based on three points. Start point, the position you lunch this app. Current, the position getting from GPS. Destination, the marked position. 
Your speed = distance of start to current / time
Estimated Arrival Time = distance to destination / Your speed
Note: Just this simple, it assume you are directly heading to your destination, so it's not accurate at all.

Features:
* Get the address of current position.
* Calculate the time to destination. 
* Option to turn off enableHighAccuracy, can be used to save battery.
* Vibrate when ETA changed
Shows GPS accuracy

latest_release.release_notes: Show visual indicator in navigation view.

changelog.release_notes:
MacID for Pebble 1.1 includes a minor change to swap the "previous" and "next" track controls, so that they're the same as the stock Pebble Music app.

To get to audio controls in MacID for Pebble, long-select on a connected Mac. Long-press again to swap between track and volume controls.

If you have any feedback or suggestions on MacID for Pebble, I'd love to hear them! You can find me on Twitter: @MacIDHelp

As always, I'll never hassle you in the app for a review, but if you do have a moment spare I'd really appreciate a rating in the iOS App Store. It really does help small independent developers like me! Thanks!

Welcoming MacID for Pebble to the MacID family!

v1 of MacID for Pebble brings the ability to lock and unlock all Macs currently connected to MacID for iOS, as well as the ability to control audio just like MacID for iOS and MacID for Apple Watch.

To lock or unlock a Mac, select a connected Mac. It couldn't be simpler. 
To control a Mac's audio, long-select on a connected Mac. You'll see an audio control screen, with information about the currently playing track. Long-select again on audio controls to swap between track and volume controls.
To speed up unlocking even further, if a Mac wakes as you walk up to it using Proximity Wake (enabled in MacID for OS X) while MacID for Pebble is active, you'll get a handy unlock notification in the app. From there you can choose to unlock or snooze requests for an hour, just like MacID for iOS and MacID for Pebble.

Got feedback? Let me know at @MacIDHelp on Twitter.

data.description:
Monitor and review your sport activities using your Smart Phone and your Pebble!

SIMPLE. POWERFUL. ACCURATE.
- Accurate tracking
- GPS, motion sensor (pedometer), altimeter, heart rate monitor, ...
- Light-weight and intuitive UI
- For all your activities: running, cycling, hiking, skiing, skating and more

100% PRIVACY, 0% ADS

- No ads, no reminders!

AUDIO-COACH

RECORD YOUR ACTIVITIES
- Distance, time, current/average/maximum speed, pace, calories, altitude, elevation gain/loss, step count/cadence/length, ...
- Live maps (streets, satellite, ...)
- Custom split table and charts
- Laps, manual and auto-pauses
- Integrated music player
- Integration with Pebble smart watches (with custom field display)
- Powerful and configurable GPS filter for a better accuracy
- Optional support for the Pebble smart watch
- Energy-saving lock screen

REVIEW AND SHARE YOUR WORKOUTS
- Innovative time line / navigation bar
- Altitude correction and elevation profile
- Share by e-mail (statistics, map, GPX file)
- Share on social networks (using the meerun.com portal)
- GPX file import/export
- 100% compatible with CascaRun

data.description: runFREE! Leave your phone at home and discover the joy of running free. So the next time you go for run forget the phone and run free! runFREE is a jogging odometer that can track how far you run without your phone. runFREE uses your stride length and step count to calculate your distance. Just enter your stride length, press start and go! If you need to take a break, press the pause button. runFREE can save your last 20 runs. The oldest run is deleted if you save more. runFREE is not intended to track walking. It works best when your forearm is in a horizontal/running position. Works with English and metric units. You can enter time and distance intervals that you want to be alerted to. Enter 1 mile or 1Km or 10 minutes. I hope you enjoy runFREE. Be sure to heart it if you like it!

data.description:
By detecting when you’ve lifted your watch hand to your neck, PulseCalc lets you intuitively calculate heart rates!

After raising your hand, you have a brief moment to get ready. Your Pebble will then vibrate and turn the background red, indicating that the timer has started. All you have to do now is count 10 heart beats, lowering your arm on the last one!

Pressing the Up Button will open the settings menu. Currently, this only lets you toggle the accelerometer usage, but more settings are on the way. These are also saved for the next time you open PulseCalc!

If you are trying to measure a patient’s heart rate, you can use the select button to manually start or stop the timer.

The Down Button allows you to toggle how many beats you have to count. If you want accuracy or you have a high heart rate, 10 beats is recommended. If you would like a faster result, there is a 5 beat option.


PLEASE NOTE:
Automatic detection assumes your body is upright, and that your watch is on your left hand. Lefties will be accommodated for in the next update, sorry!

Sorry if there are any issues on Time or Time Steel. I only have a Time Round for testing the accelerometer.

latest_release.release_notes: Initial Release.

data.description:
Rock Crusher is a match-three game for Pebble where you swap neighbouring rocks to get at least three of the same type in a row. The game ends when you have used all your lives and there are no valid moves left on the board.

CONTROLS
  * Move the cursor with the RIGHT and DOWN buttons, or TILT your wrist.
  * Enter SWAP mode by pressing the UP button.
  * In SWAP mode, choose the direction to swap with the UP, DOWN, LEFT or RIGHT button, or TILT your wrist.
  * When not in SWAP mode, press the LEFT button to save and exit.

SPECIALS
  * Match four rocks in a row to make a Pearl, which can match any colour of rock.
  * Match a rock in two directions to make Black Powder - careful, it's explosive.
  * Match five rocks in a row to blast that rock type.

This watchapp is an easy timer for the breaks between your fitness work-out sets. After 60, 90 or 120 seconds (whichever you choose) you will be notified by a gentle vibration on your wrist that it's time to hit the weights again.

Don't loose track of the number of breaks you've had on any machine ever again. Click the up button for your first break and the down button for every next break. By clicking the up button, you will reset the break counter back to 1.

Change the duration of the break with the select button. Your last choice will be remembered, even after you close and re-open the app.

Enjoy your work-outs and relax. This app will do the counting for you!

If you like it, heart it ;-)

data.author: Pretty Good Apps

changelog.release_notes:
Added support for usernames and passwords with special characters (e.g. the % sign).
Make sure to update the app and open and save your Opus settings afterwards.

New mode for skip and stop buttons.

Long pressing Select now always advances to next mode/screen. Double tap Select in menu navigation mode make Kodi navigate "back".
Only show host selector if multiple hosts available. Otherwise long pressing Select goes straight to Menu Navigation mode.

Major update!

You can now navigate Kodi's on-screen menus from your wrist. Just long press select and choose "Menu navigation".
Gave some design love to Basalt (monochrome) platform. Looking for feedback here as I rely on emulator rendering for this platform.

Different refresh intervals for different playing media types. More battery friendly and hopefully not noticeably less performant.
Remember you can always refresh the display by giving your watch a good shake.

Also vastly improved the unhappy path experience for users with network problems.
Bug fixes and stability improvements.
Show volume level as a number inside the volume bar.

New volume bar display.
When changing volume, a visual indication of your volume will now be shown for 2 seconds.
Have action bar display correct icons in short press mode and temporarily change to secondary icons when long pressed.

Finally fix that startup bug. We need better QA!
http://www.reactiongifs.com/r/kbh.gif
Fix another startup bug :'(
Fix minor upgrade bug in 1.7 :(
Support for basic auth with Kodi hosts.

Multiple host option added!
Due to popular demand (1 vote is all we need), we added a host selector to Opus. Long press the Select button when on the main screen to open the host selector.

You can now add multiple Kodi hosts to Opus via the settings app on your phone and switch between them with the host selector on your wrist. All you fancy people with multiple devices, multiple rooms or multiple houses can now rejoice!
Fixed bug with initialisation caused by wrong DEMO MODE switch.

Usability update:
 - Opus will now monitor the connection to Kodi and give the user feedback about connection problems. Please get in touch with me if you can not get Opus to connect to your Kodi installation
 - Shake your watch to update the screen. A battery-friendly alternative to regularly updating in the background.

Major update!
 - Proper start screen when Opus is not configured yet
 - Informational screen when nothing is playing
 - Start to play from stopped state
 - Show proper movie/TV show info when video is playing

data.description:
A free, beautiful remote for Kodi. Take control of your media center from your wrist.

Adjust your Kodi's volume by short pressing up and down buttons, skip to previous and next tracks or playlist items by long pressing them.
Switch to skipping and menu navigation by long pressing select and navigate Kodi's on screen menus up, down, left (long press up), right (long press down), select and back (double press select).
 
Shake your watch to update the screen. A battery-friendly alternative to regularly polling Kodi in the background.

In the host selector you can choose your active Kodi host from a list of IPs that is definable in the Settings phone app. Opus supports multiple hosts with password protection.

Opus will always be free. If you like this app, please give it a heart in the app store so that others can find it. If you love this app, donations are great for motivation.

Kodi used to be called XBMC.

latest_release.release_notes:
Added support for usernames and passwords with special characters (e.g. the % sign).
Make sure to update the app and open and save your Opus settings afterwards.

data.title: Opus - A Kodi Remote

data.description:
Are you tired of missing out on Bags of Crap? With WootCrap, your house will soon be filled with cheap crap! During one of Woot’s famous Woot-Offs, just leave this app open on your Pebble and it will track the status of the current item, with vibrations to notify you when the item is almost sold out, is sold out, and when there’s a new item. To help you collect as much crap as possible, when a wild Bag of Crap appears, the Pebble will vibrate urgently so you don’t miss out.

When you have WootCrap open and a Woot-Off is happening, the app constantly fetches updates from Woot.com to show you the current item up for sale as well as that item’s price, percent remaining, and estimated time remaining. It intelligently decides how often it should be checking the Woot site based on how much of the sale is remaining to help save their servers and save your battery life. Even when it’s not a Woot-Off day, you can use the app to see the current Woot. The watch’s up and down buttons can be used to cycle through the different Woot categories.

You have the option of setting a daily notification time in the app’s settings, so that every day you can know what is the new item for sale on Woot.

Additional Woot-Off Features:
- Vibrates when there are 5% or less of the current item remaining, so if you’re trying to find a Bag of Crap, you have time to prepare for the next item by refreshing your login
- Vibrates again when an item is sold out, and when a new item is up for sale


Note: This app is not affiliated with Woot Inc.
data.title: WootCrap

data.description:
Pixebble is the fastest way to preview your designs accurately on Pebble devices. With Pixebble, you can make sure your designs appear exactly the way you want on the Pebble OG, Pebble Time or Pebble Time Round. 

Go to www.half4.com/pixebble/ to start sending your design to your pebble watch !


Pixebble is included with a Dither library, who automatically convert the colors of your design to match the smartwatch's color palette. 

Getting Started

Pixebble is a combinaison of a web service and an app. Because it's complex to send image data to a Pebble, we cannot refresh the image in real time ; the user have to manually upload his design.

 * Download this watchapp
 * Open Pixebble website on your favorite browser
 * Set a custom Unique Identifier and add it in the settings of the watchapp.
 * Upload your image on the website
 * Shake the watch or press the middle button to get the image on the watch

data.description:
Initiate IFTTT triggers from your Pebble using the microphone.

HOW TO USE
===========
Start the app and say [trigger] [value]:

EXAMPLE
=========
"Turn lights off" .
"Turn thermostat, 70" .
"Send text Mary stuck in traffic will be late" .
"Remind me meeting at 4 pm"  .

Other supported formats are:

[trigger] [key] [value 1] [value 2] [value 3]

FEATURES
=========
- Supports multiple keys
- Set triggers that fire without confirmation
- Jump into dictation mode when opening from quick launch and exit app automatically
- Word lookup and replace (useful for converting names to email addresses)
- Vibration on success/failure so you can speak without looking
- Clean interface and glanceable icons
- Event is recorded on your Pebble timeline (optional)
- Last command saved and visible in app launcher

IFTTT.com
========
To use this app, you need to "connect" your account to the "IF Maker" channel on the IFTTT website. Then copy your maker "Key" to the app in the app settings page.

You also need to create some "recipes" on the IFTTT website that use "Maker" as the trigger and give it a name. Then add the same name in the app settings page so that the app can recognize it.

With IFTTT you can controls things like Facebook, Twitter, WeMo, Nest, OneNote, Blogger, Dropbox, Evernote, Gmail, Spotify, Wordpress, etc. 

This app does not require your IFTTT password and cannot access your IFTTT account details. Supports pmkey.xyz.

This app is NOT affiliated with IFTTT Inc.

FEEDBACK
========
Share your feedback on the Pebble forums here:
http://tinyurl.com/tttpbl

data.author: Michael D. Adams
data.description:
Vibe Time lets you check you watch without looking by vibrating your watch the current hour and minute.

Vibe Time sends the vibrations immediately when started and then quits.  For example, you could set Vibe Time as one of your quick launch entries.  That button then will send the vibes but immediately return you to the watch face.

Times are sent as three groups of vibrations.  The first is for the hour on a 12 hour clock.  The second is the tens digit of the minute.  The third is for the ones digit of the minute.

Each vibe group uses as tally system.  A short vibe is one.  A long vibe is three.  Zero is represented with four short vibes.  The codes are thus a follows:

0 => sort short short shot
1 => short
2 => short
3 => long
4 => long short
5 => long short short
6 => long long
7 => long long short
8 => long long short short
9 => long long long
10 => long long long short
11 => long long long short short
12 => long long long long
data.title: Vibe Time

This app is a somehow extended version of my first app, which only could track that one petition.
This new one can track every E Petition of the German Bundestag.
Features:
- petition search (currently only looking for petitions of the German Bundestag. could be extended to all kind of petition in the future)
- configurable language (english / german so far) will extend language support on deman

This is my ever second Pebble App, so bear with me.

data.description:
Language support: English, German

Tracking petition signatures on several petition sites. Currently available:
petitions.whitehouse.org
epetitionen.bundestag.de

Will update to allow tracking more kinds of petitions / of other countries in the future.

How to use:
On your first use, you will be asked to open the app settings on your Pebble App on your phone. Search for your desired petition by name, keyword or petition number, set your language and refresh rate. (Lower refresh rates will most likely drain your battery more than higher rates.)

Pebble use:
up button: language select
select button: refresh rate
down button: short info about the chosen petition.
Tap/Flick to force refresh.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Verfolge den Mitzeichnungsstand auf verschiedenen Petitionsseiten.
Momentan unterstützt:
epetitionen.bundestag.de
petitions.whitehouse.org

In späteren Updates, wenn die Nachfrage auch da ist, werden weitere Arten von Petitionen trackbar sein.

Wie zu benutzen:
Beim ersten Start der App, wirst du aufgefordert werden die App-Einstellungen in der Pebble App auf deinem Handy vorzunehmen.
Suche dort nach der gewünschten Petition, stelle die Anzeigesprache ein und wähle die Aktualisierungsrate aus. Niedrigere Werte werden naturgemäß eher die Batterie leeren als Höhere.

Auf deiner Pebble:
Up-Button: Sprachauswahl
Select-Button: Aktualisierungsrate
Down-Button: Kurzinfo
Tappen/Schütteln: Counter aktualisieren
